title: Virginia becomes the latest GOP-governed state to quit a voter data partnership
description: Virginia is the eighth state to leave the Electronic Registration Information Center amid fringe conservative reports and conspiracy theories attempting to connect the system to liberal activists.

title: Elon Musk says 'I've hired a new CEO' for Twitter
description: Musk indicated his successor is female, but the billionaire stopped short of naming a person.

title: Adidas finally has a plan for its stockpile of Yeezy shoes
description: One of the options Adidas considered was to destroy the Ye-designed shoes, but the company ultimately decided against it, the CEO said. Instead it will sell them and donate the proceeds to charity.

title: After nearly four decades, MTV News is no more
description: Mr. President, the world is dying to know. Is it boxers or briefs?

title: As debt ceiling talks progress, Biden and lawmakers are postponing their meeting
description: White House and congressional staff will continue to meet, but President Biden and congressional leaders will hold off on their plan to gather on Friday.

title: Alabama Republican blasts an effort to rid the military of white nationalists
description: Sen. Tommy Tuberville is under pressure for holding up military nominees over abortion policy he disagrees with. When asked about whether that is hurting military readiness, he faulted Biden.

title: As conservative states target trans rights, a Florida teen flees for a better life
description: High school sophomore Josie felt Florida officials were threatening her health care and ability to be feel safe at school. So she left. Other families of trans youth are plotting their exits as well.

title: Peloton is recalling nearly 2.2 million bikes due to a seat hazard
description: There have been reports of the seat detaching during use, causing injuries. This is Peloton's second recall for its machines. Two years ago, the company recalled its Tread+ exercise machines.

title: Hammerhead sharks 'hold their breath' in deeper, colder waters, research shows
description: Sharks are ectotherms and their internal body temperatures usually reflect the waters they swim in. Holding their breath helps them function in the frigid deep.

title: Extremists groups were found guilty of seditious conspiracy for Jan. 6. Now what?
description: New York Times journalist Alan Feuer talks about the conviction of the leaders of the Proud Boys and the Oath Keepers, and what that means for ongoing Jan. 6th-related inquiries.

title: Want your hotel room cleaned every day? Hotel housekeepers hope you say yes
description: Daily room cleaning used to be standard in hotels. Now, the union UNITE HERE is fighting to bring that back, as hotels have cut back citing worker shortages and changing guest preferences.

title: Pandemic hits 'stop button,' but for some life is forever changed
description: NPR talked to hundreds of people over the course of the pandemic. As the emergency declaration ends on May 11, we asked some of them for their reflections on the past three tumultuous years.

title: Pakistan's Supreme Court orders release of former Prime Minister Imran Khan
description: The court ruled that Khan's arrest on Tuesday was illegal and said he should be released. Khan's arrest has sparked violence in major Pakistani cities.

title: 'The East Indian' imagines the life of the first Indian immigrant to now-U.S. land
description: Brinda Charry aims to recover, reclaim, and reframe the little-known, barely footnoted history of the earliest Indian immigrant on record to what is now the United States.

title: Here's what to expect in the U.S. as Title 42 ends for asylum-seekers
description: The pandemic restrictions allowed for the quick expulsion of migrants at the border. Now that it's being lifted some officials are expecting a record influx and an impending humanitarian crisis.

title: Virginia hid execution files from the public. Here's what they don't want you to see
description: In January, the Virginia Department of Corrections restricted public access to execution records. NPR is now publishing a selection of those secret files.

title: This duo rehearsed between air raid alarms. Now they're repping Ukraine at Eurovision
description: Dozens of countries will compete in the Eurovision grand final on Saturday. Electronic duo Tvorchi is representing Ukraine, which won last year. They spoke to NPR about their journey to Liverpool.

title: An EPA proposal to (almost) eliminate climate pollution from power plants
description: Coal and natural gas-fired power plants would have to dramatically reduce the climate-warming greenhouse gasses they emit under proposed federal rules.

title: Trump continues lies about election and lashes out after N.Y. verdict in town hall
description: Trump was found liable for sexual abuse and defamation. But Trump, to be expected, dismissed all that in a CNN town hall and continued his conspiracy about the 2020 election he lost.

title: Disney's Q2 earnings: increased profits but a mixed picture
description: The Walt Disney Company reported a 13% increase in quarterly earnings on Wednesday.
